intro: Rinorea greveana, commonly known as the silverleaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Rinorea greveana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
